不要以为某些[strike]同性交友网站的[/strike]up主玩的那么欢脱就觉得这款游戏是一款娱乐向老少皆宜的游戏了。。。

[h1] MAKE NO MISTAKE[/h1]

这是一款类似于i wanna的那种过关游戏，只不过在大部分时间你没有那么容易死罢了。在有些地方卡timing的要求很高，手残表示心很累，但是还是想看炸鸡。。。

个人的一些微小的提示
[spoiler] 鸡对路面的摩擦系数很明显要比马桶对路面的摩擦系数要大，有时候弃车逃生反而更容易过关
后面的关卡基本上没有炸鸡play了，sad
蛤蟆的梗大家都知道了我就不说了，谁告诉我蛤蟆烤出来的那个长的像时钟的东西是怎么回事？
个人觉得目前我解锁的几个车：马桶车、直升摩托、烤面包机、火焰喷射器里面还是马桶好用，选车子的界面也说了，recommend
虽然看上去我蛤的人气比较高，但是我还是喜欢[strike]做[/strike]鸡，毕竟想吃鸡就要先做鸡，没毛病
中间你的鸡儿可能会卡在奇怪的地方，这时候直接返回上一个存档点就好。
我就玩完了第一幕，后面还有一幕，感觉对于我这样的手残娱乐玩家玩完总共可能要4-6小时。
第一幕最后一关我貌似卡出了一个bug，就是最后一个存档点不是毒液池里面会有平台升上来嘛，我不知道，傻不拉几跳下去死了，然后在存档点复活的时候我发现只有我一个鸡儿了，而且平台不会升上来了，害得我又重新通了一遍关。希望制作组能够修复一下吧。在没有修复之前大家就只能noch einmal了[/spoiler]

36621524.review:
Ignoring the association with PewDiePie, this is well worth the asking price. For starters, it's a solid platformer, with somewhat unique physics mechanics and varied, interesting level design. By playing through the campaign, you can unlock various characters, such as a sloth and a puffer fish, to play as, as well as hats for them to wear and vehicles for them to drive.

One of the game's stronger points is its vehicles and their impact on the way you approach levels. Similar to the different characters in Happy Wheels, there are a bunch of different vehicles in this game that each have a different 'special' ability. All (that I've seen so far at 1.6 hours) are drivable with WASD but each one has a different propulsion system that affects the physics in a different way. You start out with a bath tub with a temporary boost attached. You can unlock a car with helicopter rotors and one with a propellor on the back. These different vehicles then change the way you approach levels, as some require more precision, while others give you more freedom as to how you use the verticality of the levels.

Taking other cues from Happy Wheels, this game also has a rather diverse level editor that allows you to place pretty much anything the developer could, from platforms to spike traps to giant, spinning towers of face-whacking. And while this game doesn't have any gore in it, there is a nice feeling of impact when you hit the ground after you are invariably hit by something, and your vehicle can get increasingly beat up over time, losing its bumpers, its wheels, and even its pilot. At any time, you can eject from your vehicle to try to roll to the finish line, and should your vehicle be utterly obliterated, you can try to find a pair of wheels  and ride them. 

To go along with the level editor there is a browse level feature that allows you to play other peoples's levels, which can range from the downright absurd to 'just like Dark Souls' impossibly difficult. Provided you have the skill and time, you can actually make a level that wouldn't look out of place in the game's developer-made campaign. The campaign, meanwhile, doesn't have an actual story- more, it's a way for the developer to put their own stamp on the game in more than just its coding, and for you to unlock all the vehicles and pilots in a structured manner. 

As it's in early access, it doesn't yet have the full extent of the content it will, one day, have, but what's already here is good. Levels have a range of appearances and structures, and can be designed any way. There's loads of stuff to unlock, and each vehicle feels properly unique. And, to put the icing on the cake, you can put your own stamp on it. I would recommend.

36284321.review:
Early access comes with a lot of things, mainly being, the game being incomplete. But for what I've played so far, it's a fun platformer with different characters to use. What I can say for sure, is the game has a challenging curve already on it's early access, and I hope it stays that way. Since different rides have different effects makes it more puzzle like as well, having to learn or figure out how to go about progressing on certain areas. 

For the graphics within the game, the style is very cartoon like, and that's a plus for a game being about animals going fast as hell. The transformations from interacting with the enviroment also add a lot of charm to the game itself. Haven't tested all that's available, but I can say it's a fun ride indeed from that. 

Controllers feel responsive enough , with a standard keyboard, haven't tried a controller. But you do have to have some precision when moving if you wanna be getting those fast clear times. The control itself is not super complicated so it's simple to start from any level.  

There's not much of a story, the game just throws you in, but it has what you would call and action/arcade feel to it, so for being early access, not much of a story is expected.  If they were to add a story that be nice, maybe something fun and simple. Since the game is about having fun in a fast paced kind of way.

 Overall I'd give it a 7/10,  might change over the time playing it. The game is incomplete, this is my score for its current state.

Nui.

36262509.review:
To get this out of the way, I'm a huge Happy Wheels/PewDiePie fan. I'm not just downvoting because I don't like either one or something.

That said, I was really disappointed when I found this to be incredibly dull and repetitive. The level designs on the adventure got old within almost no time at all, and there doesn't seem to be much room for creativity. The art style isn't very unique to me either, and seemed pretty par for the course. I don't see anything too unique or groundbreaking about this game, and it doesn't seem to have much depth for what it provides. I think either the game being F2P or about $5 would be much more appropriate for what you get with this. I think the fact that the majority of reviewers (26 out of 32 reviews to now) barely went over 3 hours of play in 2 days of the games release (15 of those had an hour or less) probably is a good example of what I mean by the lack of any real depth.

36253328.review:
Wow! I mean I really wasn't expecting that much going into it considering I found the game Goat Simulator to be a bit gimmicky. But I was pleasantly surprised at how this game actually is! Now granted its in Early Access so there are some issues like the game being about 2 hours long right now (or so I'd guess, The first area took me about 40 minutes to complete), but not that that matters right now because the level editor is really in depth.

The game is batshit crazy, let's get that out there quickly. The characters are goofy, the vehicles range from plant pots to flamethrowers and the child like soundtrack with spontanous plucks and beeps really add to the personality this game is trying to build up, I mean, the game abbreviates to ASS for christs sake. 

I played about 2 online levels (which by the way people are already going crazy in the level making aspect), and I also played around with the level editor and it's exactly what you'd expect, the whole game gives me a sort of Little Big Planet vibe mixed in with Happy Wheels, its really fun.

You got your money's worth if you end up buying it. You could definitely get up to 4 hours playtime on this game for definite and I don't feel like i've wasted my money.

If there are some complaints I have, the physics can be a tiny bit jerky at some times and it doesn't feel as smooth as it probably would want to. I also would advice adding some boss fights in there, I don't know if there is in area 2 but area 1 just finished with a longer level and I was hoping to fight some big epic boss or something.

Go in expecting good, platforming fun and that is exactly what you're going to get. I reccomend this game, it is definitely worth the price and I am definitely not done with it yet :)

36222593.review: Animal Super Squad is a colorful and charming take on such games as Happy Wheels. (Video Review with gameplay) https://youtu.be/GaETY0A1zIc The game has a graphical and musical style that will please both the eyes and ears. Gameplay is highlighted by excellent controls that are responsive and sharp with a difficulty curve that eases you in and then really ramps up. I rarely feel like a death or a missed jump is due to balancing issues but rather poor timing or execution on my end. There is a level editor included with the game for creating your own content, and as it's rather extensive it is only limited by the users imagination. There are multiple vehicles, characters, and customization options available for unlock, and at the time of writing this I have a sloth, puffer fish and the starting chicken. The game really is a joy to play and I found myself with a permanent grin plastered across my face during my gaming sessions. The game also boosts quite a few graphical options to tweak allowing for play on most machines. I look forward to jumping right back into playing, and can't wait to see what amazing levels my fellow steamers dream up. Hope this helps and game on everyone.
